title: How to Change Your Nick Color in Wolfenstein Enemy Territory

steps.headline: Use these symbols when typing in your nickname:
steps.description: Add a ^ and follow that with a number or letter or symbol in front of the text you want to change. Each number from 0 to 9 is a different color. ^0 = Black, ^1 = Red, ^2 = Green, ^3 = Yellow, ^4 = Blue, ^5 = Light Blue, ^6 = Violet, ^7 = White, ^8 = Orange, ^9 = Grey. Or you can add a ^ followed by letters e.g ^a ^b ^c ^d ^e ^f etc. If you want to use a ^ in your name, you need to follow it directly by another ^. i.e. For Wolf^Player, you would have to have Wolf^^Player.

steps.headline: Remember that colored names that are the same as each other will kick the fake one.

You must remember that not all servers colours are the same like  for example ^6 this maybe red in one server but it may be different on another server, so it is a good idea to ask the people with colour on their name as it may not come out how you want it.
That will appear as: Newbie player 12345

text: Use these symbols when typing in your nickname: Add a ^ and follow that with a number or letter or symbol in front of the text you want to change. Each number from 0 to 9 is a different color. ^0 = Black, ^1 = Red, ^2 = Green, ^3 = Yellow, ^4 = Blue, ^5 = Light Blue, ^6 = Violet, ^7 = White, ^8 = Orange, ^9 = Grey. Or you can add a ^ followed by letters e.g ^a ^b ^c ^d ^e ^f etc. If you want to use a ^ in your name, you need to follow it directly by another ^. i.e. For Wolf^Player, you would have to have Wolf^^Player. Remember that colored names that are the same as each other will kick the fake one.  You must remember that not all servers colours are the same like  for example ^6 this maybe red in one server but it may be different on another server, so it is a good idea to ask the people with colour on their name as it may not come out how you want it.  Example: ^1Newbie ^8player ^312345  That will appear as: Newbie player 12345  (red) (orange)(yellow)
